channel.title: Mastering for loops?
channel.description: Well, I never really learned for loops, and I know they are helpful. I don't really know how to write them properly. It takes me 4/5 times usually to get it right. How would you guys suggest how to learn em.

item.title: Mastering for loops?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:12, topic:508584”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=626823.msg4262409#msg4262409 date=1363579484]

IDEs help quite a bit too

I would only recommend using IDEs for projects, not practice.

I would recommend using them for everything. IDEs are good practice, as you don’t want to take bad habits to a higher level. Honestly Eclipse is one of the best tools you can use to help you learn how to program in Java.
[/quote]
It depends how you look at it. Eclipse is really good for tracking down errors and finding out how to solve them, but it automatically complete some of the pieces of code you type.[/quote]
Hm, I don’t have any auto-complete options enabled then I guess… For me it’s like writing in notepad but it takes care of formatting to appeal to my eyes

Read full topic

item.title: Mastering for loops?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:11, topic:508584”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=626823.msg4262401#msg4262401 date=1363579165]

IDEs help quite a bit too

I would only recommend using IDEs for projects, not practice.
[/quote]
I would recommend using them for everything. IDEs are good practice, as you don’t want to take bad habits to a higher level. Honestly Eclipse is one of the best tools you can use to help you learn how to program in Java.[/quote]
It depends how you look at it. Eclipse is really good for tracking down errors and finding out how to solve them, but it automatically complete some of the pieces of code you type.

Read full topic

item.title: Mastering for loops?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:10, topic:508584”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=626823.msg4261430#msg4261430 date=1363495002]
IDEs help quite a bit too
[/quote]
I would only recommend using IDEs for projects, not practice.[/quote]
I would recommend using them for everything. IDEs are good practice, as you don’t want to take bad habits to a higher level. Honestly Eclipse is one of the best tools you can use to help you learn how to program in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Mastering for loops?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Loops are a critical piece of any programming language. I suggest you learn the basic for, for each, while, and do while loops. A good compliment to loops are arrays since you are dealing with sets of data and often times after to iterate over it to complete tasks.

Read full topic
